availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Kennada Sandlin (Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Fanny Morris Sandlin in Clay County, Kentucky, on May 1, 1838. Father of Lewis Sandlin, Catherine Sandlin, Sarah Sandlin, Mary Sandlin, Elizabeth Sandlin, America Sandlin, Cornelia Sandlin, John Sandlin, Martha Sandlin, Margaret J. Sandlin, and James D. W. Sandlin. Farmer in Clay County in 1850. Farmer in Jackson County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Jackson County in 1862. Farmer in Jackson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky, p. 135A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, My Division, p. 888-89.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, McKee, p. 211B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Jackson County, KY, July 1863, p. 149.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film #007728051.
"Kennada 'Canady' or 'Kan' Sandlin (1819-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial #144057175, accessed January 20, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144057175.
